titleInfo.title: Letter, Anson Nelson in Nashville, Tenn., to J.G.M. Ramsey in Knoxville, Tenn. 1874 Aug. 15

mods.abstract: Anson Nelson wrote this letter to J.G.M. Ramsey, on Aug. 15, 1874. Nelson mentioned the [Tennessee]Historical Society. He agreed with Ramsey that the Society should address a letter to the Hon. Mrs. James K. Polk in relation to the final disposition of the Polk papers. Nelson wrote of her great interest in the Society. She told Nelson she probably would turn her husband's papers over to the Society. He thanked Ramsey for sending him an extract from a letter of the Hon. Lyman C. Draper and had much praise for Draper. Nelson wished Ramsey success in obtaining other historical papers. He mentioned an event planned for Oct. 6 in observance of the anniversary of the battle of Kings Mountain. He also mentioned that Dr. Lindsley was preparing a catalogue of the effects of the Society. He sent regards to Ramsey from several people and news about some nominations.

subject.topic: Presidents -- United States -- History -- 19th century -- Archives.
Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884 -- Correspondence.
